results.title: Der Rosenkavalier
results.creator_credit: Paul Czinner, Poetic Films and Rank Organisation Film Productions
results.brief_description: Filmed on location at Salzburg during a performance at the Salzburg Festival, Paul Czinner’s production of Richard Strauss’s “Der Rosenkavalier”, an opera in three acts, with libretto by Hugo Von Hofmannsthal, is elegant and quite sumptuous with elaborate sets and costumes. Set in 18th century feudal Vienna during the reign of Empress Maria Theresia, the story revolves around Princess von Werdenberg (Elisabeth Schwarzkopf), her husband Baron Ochs von Lerchenau (Otto Edelmann) and her lover Octavian (Sena Jurinac). Cast also includes Annaliese Rothenberger and Erich Kunz. Features the Vienna State Opera Chorus and Ballet and the Vienna Philharmonic Orchestra conducted by Herbert Von Karajan. Sung in German with story outline before each act in English text.

results.title: Paradise
results.creator_credit: Ishu Patel, Douglas MacDonald and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: A technical and visual masterpiece created by Ishu Patel. His creation of a fantastic kingdom where a Divine Bird performs a magic dance for an adoring emperor has won international acclaim. Innovative mixed-media techniques and dramatic lighting create a fabulous crystal chamber which is both palace and prison. A palace for the jealous blackbird who covets such an artificial paradise, and a prison for the Divine Bird, who has never enjoyed the freedom of the forest. Photographed by Pierre Landry. Animated by Ishu Patel and George Ungar. Music by Gheorghe Zamfir. (Awards: Berlin; Annecy; Gijon; Spain; Melbourne; Antibes-Juan-les-Pins; Los Angeles; Adelaide; Hamilton; Oakland; New York; Oscar nomination, Hollywood.)

results.title: Der Rosenkavalier
results.creator_credit: Brian Large, Robin Scott, BBC-TV and National Video Corporation
results.brief_description: This opulent new production by Oscar-winning film director John Schlesinger marks the 25th anniversary of Sir Georg Solti’s spectacular debut at the Royal Opera House at Covent Garden. This is an opera in three acts by Richard Strauss, with libretto by Hugo von Hofmannsthal. The music is provided by the Orchestra of the Royal Opera House, conducted by Georg Solti. The scene is Vienna in the early years of the reign of Empress Maria Theresa, the story beginning with the love affair between The Marschallin (Kiri Te Kanawa) the wife of Field Marshall Prince Werdenberg and her latest lover, the young Count Octavian (Anne Howells). The action begins when the Marschallin’s roguish cousin Baron Ochs (Aage Haugland) stumbles into their bed chamber and mistakes the disguised Count for the Marschallin’s woman servant and falls madly in love with her. Complications arise as the noble young Count finds himself falling in love with Och’s betrothed, the enchantingly vulnerable Sophie (Barbara Bonney).

results.title: Paperland: the bureaucrat observed
results.creator_credit: Donald Brittain, Marrin Canell, Canadian Broadcasting Corporation and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Bureaucracy shapes our lives and guides us from the cradle to the grave. This documentary lays bare the idiosyncrasies of bureaucracy whether in Canada, Austria, Hungary, the Vatican, or the Virgin Islands. Looks at the strengths and weaknesses common to all bureaucracies, the importance of paper and written authority, resistance to change, hierarchical organisation, absense of individual accountability. Examines the relationship between the public service and those it serves and the power politics at the top of the hierarchy. It also attempts to make the functioning of public service more comprehensible. The absurdities of bureaucratic behaviour are exposed with humour and irreverence. Written by Donald Brittain, Ronald Blummer and John T. Random. Narrated by Donald Brittain. (Awards: Toronto)

results.title: Depreciation and inflation (NP)
results.brief_description: John Cleese plays the foolhardy businessman who thinks he has had a successful year in his factory operation, unaware that inflation and depreciation of capital investment have been eating away at his profits. His crockery and cutlery business has also fallen prey to the clutches of inflation. Cleese’s more astute business friend informs him of his ignorance, providing a clear and simple explanation of the economic concepts. FOR USE ONLY IN A DOMESTIC SITUATION OR FOR EDUCATIONAL PURPOSES ONLY.

results.title: PANACEA: the documentary
results.creator_credit: Ioannis Ioannou, Cinemedia, Rose Myers, Vanessa Rouse and Arena Theatre Company
results.brief_description: ‘PANACEA the documentary’ follows the journey of Arena Theatre Company’s creative team as they embark on an ambitious large scale performance event fusing modern technology and cinematic devices. A combination of conventional theatre and MTV culture.

results.title: Pandora
results.creator_credit: Derek May, Tom Daly and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Experimental filmmaker Derek May and colour cameraman Martin Duckworth collaberated here in a surrealistic retelling of the old myth. A film of technical experiment with forceful, colourful effect and creative use of shadows.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Derek May, Tom Daly and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: Panasonic VHS-C Movie Camera NV-A1
results.brief_description: The Panasonic VHS-C Movie Camera NV-A1 was a condensed VHS (Video Home System) videocassette format, which was mainly used in consumer-grade camcorders. It was a smaller size than VHS, as with Betamax, but could be played in a standard VCR with an adaptor.
results.description: Various magnetic tape technologies were produced during the period of the videotape format wars during the late 1970s and early 80s, which was particularly significant for the amateur filmmaker market. Cameras became more and more compact, making them cheaper and portable. The Panasonic VHS-C Movie Camera NV-A1 was a condensed VHS (Video Home System) videocassette format, which was mainly used in consumer-grade camcorders. It was a smaller size than VHS, as with Betamax, but could be played in a standard VCR with an adaptor making the footage easier to access than ever before.
description_for_label: Various magnetic tape technologies were produced during the period of the videotape format wars during the late 1970s and early 80s, which was particularly significant for the amateur filmmaker market. Cameras became more and more compact, making them cheaper and portable. The Panasonic VHS-C Movie Camera NV-A1 was a condensed VHS (Video Home System) videocassette format, which was mainly used in consumer-grade camcorders. It was a smaller size than VHS, as with Betamax, but could be played in a standard VCR with an adaptor making the footage easier to access than ever before.

results.title: Der Freischutz
results.creator_credit: Hartmut Schottler, Achim Freyer, National Video Corporation, Osterreichischer Rundfunk-Fernsehen and Zweites Deutsches Fernsehen
results.brief_description: Carl Maria von Weber’s opera “Der Freischutz” with libretto by Friedrich Kind first premiered in Berlin in 1821. This production by Achim Freyer was performed in Stuttgart by the Wurttemberg State Opera Chorus and Orchestra, with Ulrich Eistert as Chorus master and musical direction by Dennis Russell Davies. Romantic, melodramatic, evil and mystical, this German folkloric tale set in the Bohemian forest tells of a rivalry between Max (Toni Kramer) and Kaspar (Wolfgang Probst) over the hand of the beautiful young Agathe (Catarina Ligendza), daughter of Kuno (Fritz Linke) the head Ranger to Prince Ottokar. For Max to be worthy of marrying Agathe, he has to win the traditional shooting contest on his wedding morning. Kaspar has already sold his soul to the devil - will Max do the same? Using colorful set designs, costumes and make-up, this stage performance has a Grimm’s fairytale quality, albeit an adult fairytale. Cast also includes Wolfgang Schone and Raili Viljakainen. Sung in German with no English subtitles. Includes booklet with English translation.
